definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
come without a shadow, leave without a footprint (idiom); to come and leave without a trace
lit. to appear and disappear unpredictably like a spirit or a ghost (idiom)/fig. elusive
lit. come without a shadow, leave without a footprint (idiom); to come and go without a trace
pinyin: lai2 wu2 ying3 , qu4 wu2 zong1

definition: to come and go/to roam about (mostly unseen)/(of a ghost) to haunt (a place)/(of a criminal) to stalk (the streets)/(of the sun) to rise and set
to hide/to conceal and avoid (contact)/to keep sth concealed
lit. to summon demons to create havoc (idiom)/fig. to stir up all kinds of trouble
dark and uninhabited (idiom); remote and deserted/God-forsaken
lit. men's footprints are rare (idiom)/fig. off the beaten track/lonely/deserted
